article:
# Recipe: Oven Mediterranean Chicken

## Table of Contents
- [Introduction](#introduction)
- [Ingredients](#ingredients)
- [Equipment](#equipment)
- [Preparation Time](#preparation-time)
- [Cooking Time](#cooking-time)
- [Steps](#steps)
- [Serving Suggestions](#serving-suggestions)
- [Variations](#variations)
- [Tips and Tricks](#tips-and-tricks)
- [Nutritional Information](#nutritional-information)
- [Storage and Leftovers](#storage-and-leftovers)
- [Frequently Asked Questions](#frequently-asked-questions)

## Introduction
The Oven Mediterranean Chicken is a delicious and healthy dish inspired by the flavors of the Mediterranean region. This recipe combines tender chicken with a variety of vibrant herbs and spices, creating a flavorful and aromatic meal. It is a versatile dish that can be enjoyed on its own or paired with your favorite sides.

## Ingredients
- 4 chicken breasts
- 2 tablespoons olive oil
- 2 cloves garlic, minced
- 1 teaspoon dried oregano
- 1 teaspoon dried basil
- 1 teaspoon dried thyme
- 1 teaspoon paprika
- 1/2 teaspoon salt
- 1/4 teaspoon black pepper
- 1 lemon, sliced
- 1/4 cup pitted Kalamata olives
- 1/4 cup crumbled feta cheese
- Fresh parsley, for garnish

## Equipment
- Baking dish
- Mixing bowl
- Knife
- Cutting board
- Measuring spoons

## Preparation Time
- 10 minutes

## Cooking Time
- 25 minutes

## Steps
1. Preheat the oven to 400째F (200째C).
2. In a small bowl, combine the olive oil, minced garlic, dried oregano, dried basil, dried thyme, paprika, salt, and black pepper. Mix well to create a marinade.
3. Place the chicken breasts in a baking dish and pour the marinade over them, ensuring they are evenly coated. Allow the chicken to marinate for at least 10 minutes.
4. Arrange the lemon slices on top of the chicken breasts.
5. Scatter the Kalamata olives around the chicken in the baking dish.
6. Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 25 minutes or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165째F (74째C).
7. Remove the baking dish from the oven and sprinkle the crumbled feta cheese over the chicken.
8. Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.

## Serving Suggestions
- Serve the Oven Mediterranean Chicken with a side of roasted vegetables and couscous.
- It also pairs well with a fresh Greek salad and tzatziki sauce.

## Variations
- For a spicier version, add a pinch of red pepper flakes to the marinade.
- Substitute chicken breasts with chicken thighs for a juicier result.
- Add diced tomatoes and red onions to the baking dish for extra flavor and color.

## Tips and Tricks
- Make sure to evenly coat the chicken with the marinade for maximum flavor.
- If you prefer a crispier skin, broil the chicken for a few minutes at the end of the cooking time.
- Allow the chicken to rest for a few minutes before serving to ensure the juices redistribute and the meat remains tender.

## Nutritional Information
- Calories: 320 per serving
- Fat: 15g
- Protein: 35g
- Carbohydrates: 8g
- Fiber: 2g

## Storage and Leftovers
- Store any leftovers in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
- Reheat in the oven or microwave until heated through before serving.

## Frequently Asked Questions
1. Can I use bone-in chicken instead of chicken breasts?
   - Yes, bone-in chicken can be used. Adjust the cooking time accordingly to ensure the chicken is fully cooked.
2. Can I use fresh herbs instead of dried herbs?
   - Yes, you can use fresh herbs. Double the amount of herbs specified in the recipe if using fresh.
3. Can I make this recipe ahead of time?
   - Yes, you can marinate the chicken in advance and store it in the refrigerator until ready to bake.
